issues.description: The problem statement explicitly requires that every class/interface be declared public (problem_statement.md line 5). The reference solution declares the Pneumatic interface without the public modifier (solution_repository/src/de/tum/in/ase/Pneumatic.java lines 1-9), making it package-private. This contradicts the problem requirement and the UML's intention to expose the interface. Students reading the statement will expect Pneumatic to be public; the solution's package-private visibility is an unintentional structural inconsistency and violates the stated design constraint.
issues.suggested_fix: Declare the interface as public in the solution (and template if present). Change the interface declaration to: public interface Pneumatic { void raisePressure(int pressureIncrease); void openValve(); } This aligns the solution with the problem statement requirement that every class/interface be public.
